value.title: Drupal Views | Drush Site-Install
value.description: <div class="az-element az-section" style="" data-az-id="gb7jbwro0x" data-azat-pid="gbrsrsftha" id="gbrsrsftha" data-azb="az_section"><div class="az-ctnr container" data-azcnt="true"><div class="az-element az-text" style="" data-az-id="gbtl4ux07l" data-azat-pid="gbx7hioi3z" id="gbx7hioi3z" data-azb="az_text" data-azcnt="true"><h2>The below Views display should list the most recently added users on this website and also i

body.value:
The below Views display should list the most recently added users on this website and also include the Title of the block.

The below Views display should list Drupal's log messages

The below Views display should list Drupal's log messages, and limit it to show only 5 messages

The below Views display should list Drupal's log messages, and limit it to show only 5 messages of the "type" System.

@todo this block should also have a warning message that Ajax needs to be enabled to use the filter.

The below Views display should list Drupal's log messages, and because the option "Show exposed filters" is enabled, it should display a warning in red that the Ajax option needs to be switched on for this Views display

A views exposed form will only work for both anonymous users and editors if it has Ajax enabled.

On the right-hand side is a block that has "Pager offset" set to 4. This means the first item in this Views display should be the same as the last item in the Views display on the left-hand side.

The below view demonstrates support for Views' Contextual Filter feature by displaying the Node title of this page.

Below we demonstrate that we can override the Contextual Filter value in the front-end with DXPR Builder. The below Views display should show the title of the Node with Node ID 10.
